title: Calories in Jack Daniel's Whiskey
meta_description: Discover calories in Jack Daniel's whiskey per standard shot, plus nutrition facts, equivalents, and tweaks for mixers—no carbs or protein.
assumptions: Standard 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving, 40% ABV (80 proof), straight—no mixers or ice dilution.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by proof, serving size, and brand specifics; mixers or garnishes add calories. Drink responsibly and check labels.

quick_answer.text: A standard 1.5 oz shot of Jack Daniel's whiskey has ~97 calories from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison; alcohol provides empty calories.

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of Jack Daniel's?
faqs.a: About 97 kcal for a 1.5 oz shot at 40% ABV.

faqs.q: Does Jack Daniel's have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: No—0 g carbs, fiber, or sugars; calories are purely from alcohol.

faqs.q: Calories in Jack Daniel's and Coke?
faqs.a: A standard mix adds ~140 kcal from cola, totaling ~237 kcal.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in Jack Daniel's?
faqs.a: Higher proof (e.g., 100 proof) increases calories slightly; 80 proof is ~97 kcal per shot.

faqs.q: Is Jack Daniel's low-calorie compared to other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar to most 80-proof whiskeys at ~97 kcal per 1.5 oz—varies minimally by brand.
